title: 40 workers can complete a job in 15 days. How many workers should be employed in order to complete the job in 8 days? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends…! 40 workers can complete a job in 15 days To complete the work mandate required = 40 men × 15 days = 600 mandate Now the job has to be completed in 8 days Thus number of man will be required = total mandate work / no of workers Number of man required = 600/8 man = 75 man Answer: total 75 workers should be employed in order to complete the job in 8 days.

Let the total work be 120 units. Efficiency of 40 worker = 120/15 = 8 units/day Efficiency of 1 worker (n1) = 8/40 = 1/5 units/ day Let the no. Of workers needed to complete the job in 8 days be x. So, x * n1 * 8 = 120 => 1/5 * 8 * x = 120 => x = 75 So, total number of workers needed to complete the work in 8 days is 75.

THe work requires 40*15 = 600 worker-days. If the work is to be completed in 8 days, you required = 600 worker-days/8 days = 75 workers. CAUTION: If the job is in a big area like a road project, 75 workers can be employed. But in a confined space like a well construction, you cannot engage 75 workers,
40 workers take 15 days, so the entire job will take: 40 x 15=600 worker-days Then: 600 worker-days/8 days=75 workers needed to finish in 8 days ………………………
In 15days 40 workers can complete the job. In 1 day 40x15 workers can do the job In 8 days (40x15)/8 can finish the work = 75 workers ANS
